task.title: Lubricate the Mechanics
task.shortdesc: Your typewriter does not require regular lubrication. However, metal-on-metal components can develop friction, which will require occasional lubrication.

step.cmd: Identify metal-on-metal connections, gears, and pivot points that seem to be hesitant in movement or completely stiff.

step.note: Common areas that will need lubrication include the carriage rails, and internal pivot points, levers, and gears.
step.cmd: Using a precision applicator, such as a small pipet or medicine dropper, apply one to two drops of oil where needed, immediately wiping away the excess with a rag or cotton swab.
